titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas Pollard, William Wing, and Richard Rodgers, Indictment
CWG7385

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Caldwell Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,, Plff
Against } November 1865
Thomas Pollard. William Wing and Richard Rodgers. Defts

The Grand Jury of Caldwell County, in the name and by the authority of Commonwealth of Kentucky: accuse Thomas Pollard, William Wing and Richard Rodgers of the crime of Stealing a mule committed as follows viz: The said Thomas Pollard, William Wing and Richard Rodgers on the 10" day of June 1864. in the County aforesaid, Willfully and feloniously took and carried away one Brown horse Mule the personal property of W F Lilly and of the One hundred dollars and against the peace and dignity of the commonwealth of Kentucky.

John J McLin
Foreman Grand Jury
E P Campbell Attorney for ^the^ Commonwealth

Information given by==
W. F. Lilly
J D Irvin
David Alsup
N M Nichols

A Copy
atteste J C Barnes Clk
By F W Dabney &C
Bench Warrant to Issue & bail fixed at $200. each

R T Petree
a copy
atteste J C Barnes clk
By F W Dabney, D C

Comth
v } Indictment for Stealing a mule
Thomas Pollard & others
a true bill
John J McLin
Foreman Grand Jury
Filed & noted in open court Decr 2d 1865.
att J C Barnes clk
a copy
fee 30,Â¢
